Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 8 (SC 8465A): contains 5746 only.
_description: George Ripley(?), alchemical poem on the Ripley scrolls — six couplets

BodAshRol40.First Lines:
In the See withouten leesStode the Byrd of
                    hermes…
BodAshRol40.Last Lines:
…Vnderstand non well A RightAnd thanck god of this
                    Sight

CamFitz276.First Lines:
In the see wythe outten leseStandith the bride of ermesEtynge
                    his wynges variabelleAnd maketh hem selfe þe full
                    stabill…
CamFitz276.Last Lines:
…vnder stande nowe well and rygtheAnd thanke þou god of
                    this syete
CamFitz276.Note:
Six couplets accompanying illustration of and eagle on a globe; follows
                        5107.

EDCPRS.First Lines:
In the se[ ] withoutten lesestandes the birde of
                    hermes…
EDCPRS.Last Lines:
…vnderstande [ ] well a right& thanke thou god of this
                    sighte
EDCPRS.Note:
Six couplets in two columns of 3 x 2 each; fourth verse on scroll; word
                    rubbed so illegible.
EDCPRS.Editions:
McCallum,  R. I. 
             “The Ripley Scroll of the Royal College of Physicians of
                Edinburgh.” 
             Vesalius
         2:1 (June, 1996): 39-49: 39-46.

PUL93.First Lines:
In The see wythe owtyn leseStonte the bryde off
                    ermes…
PUL93.Last Lines:
…Vnder stond now ffull and reyghtAnd thanke þov god off
                    thys same seyte
PUL93.Note: 6 couplets, each line alternating red and black.

HunHM30313.First Lines:
In the sea withouten leesStoude the Byrd of
                    Hermes…
HunHM30313.Last Lines:
…Vnderstand now well A Right& thancke God of this
                    Sight
HunHM30313.Note: 12 lines, third among four under this number.
